data.title: CHINESE ACQUIRE OHORONGO CEMENT
data.meta_description: Concrete Trends: Your Ultimate Source for Concrete Industry Insights. Discover the latest news, innovations, and project reports. Serving the global concrete and construction sector, with a focus on Africa. Unlock the potential of this unique construction material today
data.text:
The deal has been inked and the

Chinese-owned company, International Cement Group (ICG), has acquired SCHWENK

Namibia’s 69.83% stake in Ohorongo cement.

Ohorongo Cement was until

recently owned by SCHWENK Namibia, Industrial Corporation South Africa (IDC)

14.27% and Development Bank Namibia (DBN) 11.73% and Development Bank of

Southern Africa (DBSA) 4.17%.

Di-Anna Grobler, Development Bank

of Namibia (DBN) spokesperson stated that the bank and its shareholder the

Government of Namibia were not aware of Schwenk International’s intention to sell.

According to the Singapore Stock Exchange News Service (SENS), the agreed total

price is US104.4 million in cash (approximately N$1.5 billion using a rate of

USD to NAD14.5212 as at 12 March 2019).

The minority owners and shareholders of Ohorongo, were only formally informed

about the transaction at its last Board Meeting held in Windhoek recently.
